content: The Autocomplete component combines a text input with a listbox. It can be populated with static items defined directly in JSX (`AutocompleteItem`), or with dynamic items from an external data source passed to the `items` prop.
Key features include disabled states (`isDisabled`, `disabledKeys`), required fields (`isRequired`), read-only mode (`isReadOnly`), and allowing custom user values (`allowsCustomValue`).

Autocomplete supports multiple `sizes`, `colors`, and `variants` (flat, bordered, faded, underlined). The label position can be changed with `labelPlacement`. You can also add `startContent` and `endContent`.
Autocomplete supports async operations. Use a hook like `useAsyncList` for asynchronous filtering and loading of data from a server.
For long lists, virtualization can be enabled with the `isVirtualized` prop for improved performance. You may need to set `maxListboxHeight` and `itemHeight` for it to work correctly.
Autocomplete can be a controlled component. Use `selectedKey` with `onSelectionChange` to control the selection, and `inputValue` with `onInputChange` to control the text.
Key stylable slots for Autocomplete include `base`, `listboxWrapper`, `popoverContent`, `clearButton`, and `selectorButton`.
You can group items using the `AutocompleteSection` component. The section itself can be styled using its `classNames` property.
